quotes.quote: I love to breathe. Oxygen is sexy!
The air up there in the clouds is very pure and fine, bracing and delicious. And why shouldn't it be? it is the same the angels breathe.
Do not be afraid that joy will make the pain worse; it is needed like the air we breathe.
Remember to breathe. It is after all, the secret of life.
It's a breath you took too late.It's a death that's worse than fate.
When you own your breath, nobody can steal your peace.

Try to learn to breathe deeply, really to taste food when you eat, and when you sleep, really to sleep. Try as much as possible to be wholly alive with all your might, and when you laugh, laugh like hell. And when you get angry, get good and angry. Try to be alive. You will be dead soon enough.
One should not go into churches if one wants to breathe pure air.
Only when you explore the ecstasy of simply being, where even to breathe is a distraction, can you call yourself complete.
When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive, to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.
Breath is the finest gift of nature. Be grateful for this wonderful gift.
Breathing is the greatest pleasure in life.
I would like to say that your beauty made it difficult to breathe.
Remember how to breathe, how to live, please!!
Underwear makes me uncomfortable and besides my parts have to breathe.
Breathe and don't try to be perfect.
Breath is the bridge which connects life to consciousness, which unites your body to your thoughts.
While we breathe, we will hope.
The delicous breath of rain was in the air.
If you woke up breathing, congratulations! You have another chance.
The more we talk about our troubles and our fears, the more life we breathe into them.
I live and breathe every element in life.
Breathing, according to me, corresponds to taking charge of one's own life.
You are that one breath. that puts all the remaining breaths. back into my body.
Breathe. It's only a bad day not a bad life.
I write for the same reason I breathe because if I didn't, I would die.
And when I breathed, my breath was lightning.
Do you mind if I sit back a little? Because your breath is very bad.
I have to be a star like another man has to breathe.
He lives most life whoever breathes most air.
Bliss begins with the breath. We breathe in, and accept all that is new. We breathe out, and release all that has passed.
You honestly expect me to breathe in a world without air?
The air we breathe is still free, but for how much time. I believe someone is busy patenting it to start selling it for profit
Happiness breathes when you do.
This air we breathe is precious, and the glaciers helped me understand that and stay focused on that.
As you breathe in, cherish yourself. As you breathe out, cherish all Beings.
Every breath is a resurrection.
Conscious breathing is the best antidote to stress, anxiety and depression.
Keep breathing. Just keep doing it. It's easy. In and out.
There is one way of breathing that is shameful and constricted. Then, there's another way: a breath of love that takes you all the way to infinity.
To know even one life has breathed easier because you have lived. This is to have succeeded.
Your omnipresence is marvellous! I breathe and you enter me. I exhale and enter into you.
The moment you breathe your first breath, you won.
Take every breath as an event.
As long as I breathe, I attack.
What can we do but keep on breathing in and out, modest and willing, and in our places?
Just breathe. Ten tiny breaths. Seize them. Feel them. Love them.
Breathe life back into your ambitions, your desires, your goals, your relationships.
It is a common belief that we breathe with our lungs alone, but in point of fact, the work of breathing is done by the whole body.
Breathe gently. Let go of your thoughts, past and future, memories and plans.
Breathe quietly and let it be. Let your body relax and your heart soften. Open to whatever you experience without fighting.
We breathe when we're wrong, we breathe when we're right, we breathe even as we slip off the ledge toward an early grave. It cannot be undone.
We breathe so that the trees thrive and the trees breathe so that we are able to live. Perfect symbiosis.
Breathe. Don't panic and flee. Sink. Feel it all. Imagine. Let it burn.
Now breathe, and step out again, a step further from the past. Step into the streets as narrow as bones, the white streets of the labyrinth, and breathe deeply. Breathe, and step out once more.

When life's storms threaten to drown us we just do our best to keep calm, carry on, and breathe. If I've learned one thing along the way it's that learning to breathe again is a team sport and we all need a little help along the way.

There are so many distractions in your daily life that taking the time to pause and consciously breathe is a gift you can give yourself – and in so doing you give it to others who feel your sense of calm and inner strength.
Breathe in, take what life hands you; hold it, accept it; breathe out, let it go.
Some things are out of your control, but not your breath, so breathe in with me, okay?
The more you breathe, the more you feel.
No man should have to fight to breathe in good health and peace.

The deep breathe you just took to show that your problems are bigger than you, is the final breathe someone had taken right now in his life! As long as your breathe is not the final one, you still have a hope!
It would be ridiculous to hold your breath and blame others for your inability to breathe.
You feel yourself a broken one and you still breathe.
Now but to breathe its praise, minds me in many ways.
Breathe softly into it, accepting all that is present with a healing kindness.
The air we breathe, the wind that blows around us, the earth that we walk upon, the lives of others around us, the most intimate things of our lives, are the place of our sleep or of our awakening.
Thoughts that breathe, and words that burn.
For you, I'll stay invisible. I'll be the air you breathe.
Fill your paper with the breathings of your heart.
Through Christ, you can breathe again, inhaling the wonder of God that always surrounds you, exhaling words and deeds of praise that reflect all of who He is.
I wish that I could breathe, if only I could breathe.
Breathe with unconditional breath the unconditioned air.
You are breathing patiently; it is a beautiful sound. It is your life, which is so close to my own that I would not know.
Breathing dreams like air.
There is no difference between your breathing and the breathing of the rain forest, between your bloodstream and the world’s rivers, between your bones and the chalk cliffs of Dover.

With every breath, the old moment is lost; a new moment arrives. We exhale and we let go of the old moment. It is lost to us. In doing so, we let go of the person we used to be. We inhale and breathe in the moment that is becoming.
Breathing in, let golden light come into you through your head.
